docs.text:
Introduction


These are the specifications developed by the 
Local Waste Service Standards Project
.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: These are the specifications developed by the  Local Waste Service Standards Project .
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text:
Service


Use cases and requirements


The Service model should have properties for:


name




For identification.




frequency




An indication of typically how often the collection is run.




description




For specific instructions about the service, such as when and where to put containers out, that bin lids must be closed, etc.




next collections




To know upcoming dates of when upcoming collections will happen.




previous collections




To know when the last few collections have taken place.




material stream




What kinds of materials are handled by this service.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Description










name


Text


Name of the service.






frequency


Text


How often it runs, e.g. weekly.






description


Text


Additional descriptive text.






next collections


Date


List of dates of next collections.






previous collections


Date


List of dates of previous collections.






material stream


?


The material stream that is collected.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "name": "Recycling"
}


    

  






Codelists


Freqency


TBD

docs.text: Term  Mapping  Description      name  Text  Name of the service.    frequency  Text  How often it runs, e.g. weekly.    description  Text  Additional descriptive text.    next collections  Date  List of dates of next collections.    previous collections  Date  List of dates of previous collections.    material stream  ?  The material stream that is collected.
docs.title: Properties

docs.text:
Event


Use cases and requirements


The Event model should have properties for:


event type




What kind of event it is.




date created




1 Jan 2015




UPRN




For recording against specific properties.




USRN




For recording street-level information.




coordinates




For easy geolocation of where the event was recorded.




image




Visual evidence of an issue.




comments




For any additional information useful to record.




Properties








Term


Mapping


Description










event type


string


A categorisation of the event.






date created


string


Timestamp.






uprn


string


A unique identifier for a property.






usrn


string


A unique identifier for a street.






geo


GeoCoordinates


The location in WGS84 datum.






image


URL


A URL to an related image.








Serialisation




  

  

    
JSON Schema

    
JSON

  


  

  

    

    

    

      
{
  "event_type": "Not presented",
  "date_created": "2014-05-23T20:00",
  "uprn": "123456789012",
  "usrn": "123456789012",
  "image": "http://example.com/images/123.png",
  "geo": {
    "@type": "GeoCoordinates",
    "latitude": "40.75",
    "longitude": "73.98"
  }
}

docs.title: Properties

docs.text:
Missed collection reasons





  
ID

  
Name

  
Description






  
1

  
Not presented

  
The container is not presented at the curbside.






  
2

  
Contaminated

  
The contents of the container is contaminated with waste not suitable for that collection.






  
3

  
Too heavy

  
The container contents is too heavy for safe collection.
docs.title: Missed collections

docs.text:
ID 
   Name 
   Description   
   1 
   Not presented 
   The container is not presented at the curbside.   
   2 
   Contaminated 
   The contents of the container is contaminated with waste not suitable for that collection.   
   3 
   Too heavy 
   The container contents is too heavy for safe collection.

Waste Services API


Services


/services




Get a list of waste services



  
get

  
/services





Response


[

description
: 
Please put your recycling box on the street.
,
    
frequency
: 
weekly
,
    
id
: 1,
    
esd_id

http://id.esd.org.uk/service/524
,
    
name
: 
Recycling service

  }
]
